definition: to waste (one's energy etc)
surname Bai

white/snowy/pure/bright/empty/blank/plain/clear/to make clear/in vain/gratuitous/free of charge/reactionary/anti-communist/funeral/to stare coldly/to write wrong character/to state/to explain/vernacular/spoken lines in opera
surname Fei
to cost/to spend/fee/wasteful/expenses
to whistle down the wind/to waste one's breath (idiom)

sentences.english: The papal captain have vainly endeavoured to induce his wife to remain behind him .
sentences.chinese: 教廷的隊長曾白費力氣地試圖說服妻子留下不去。

sentences.english: But now it eems that all the hard work may have been in vain.
sentences.chinese: 但現在看來，所有的努力都可能白費了。

sentences.english: You are wasting your breath; he won't change his mind.
sentences.chinese: 你在白費口舌，他不會改變主的。

sentences.english: Governments waste a lot of breath on their plans to make the economy more competitive.
sentences.chinese: 政府在使經濟更具競爭性方面的計劃白費了很多脣舌。

sentences.english: It does not help asking the question once your anger has been aroused.
sentences.chinese: 一旦你的憤怒被激起，問你什麼問題都是白費力氣。

sentences.english: I had worked for what seemed like nothing.
sentences.chinese: 我所努力的最後似乎都白費了。

sentences.english: Your efforts will go to waste if you give it up.
sentences.chinese: 你要是放棄，心血就會白費。

sentences.english: His failure made a mockery of his friend's great efforts to help him.
sentences.chinese: 他的失敗使他的朋友幫助他的一番心血白費了。

sentences.english: My efforts were not in vain.
I've already made up my mind. There's no sense flogging a dead horse .
sentences.chinese: 我已經下了決心，不必再白費口舌了。

sentences.english: Asking him is wasting my breath.
I tryed very hard to persuade him to quit smoking,but to no purpose.
sentences.chinese: 我說服他戒菸，但卻白費力氣。

sentences.english: Save your breath, the boss will never give you the day off.
sentences.chinese: 別白費口舌了，老闆不會給你假的。

sentences.english: Final results showed that we beat our head against the wall.
sentences.chinese: 但是最後結果表明我們白費力氣了。

sentences.english: So you see , my dear , you ' ve abased yourself to no purpose.
sentences.chinese: 你看，親愛的，你白費一番苦心貶低自己了。

sentences.english: All of that is wasted effort.
sentences.chinese: 所有那一切都是白費力氣。

definition: to take a lot of trouble (over sb or sth)/may I trouble you (to do sth)
to exhaust/to use up/to deplete/to drain
laborious
at long last/finally/on the whole
labor/able-bodied worker/laborer/work force
to suffer untold hardships (idiom); trials and tribulations/with difficulty/after some effort
to spend effort/to take trouble/May I trouble you to...? (as part of polite request)/Please would you mind...?
to temper oneself/to steel oneself/self-discipline/endurance
to strive one's hardest/to spare no effort
to have nothing to say (idiom)
determination/resolution/determined/firm and resolute/to make up one's mind/CL:個|个[ge4]
arduous and thankless task (idiom); strenuous and unrewarding
impossible/can't be done/no can do/unable to accomplish
empty-handed (idiom); fig. not receiving anything
to work hard/to look after
lit. look into one's heart, no shame (idiom); with a clear conscience
